prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism has a slightly tapered shape, with the narrowest point at the top. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. **Create the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch** Draw a 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face (face_1). Face_1 should contain one loop (loop_1). Loop_1 should contain four lines: - Line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5] - Line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] - Line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.125 units and along the opposite direction of the normal by 0.125 units. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom that is tapered. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with Rounded Corners Construct a rectangular prism with rounded corners. 1. **Create the coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.25, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch** Draw a new 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch should contain a single face (face_1). Face_1 should contain one loop (loop_1). Loop_1 should contain four lines: - Line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0] - Line_2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.2492, 0.25] - Line_3: Start Point [0.2492, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] - Line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.25. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.375 units. Use the CutFeatureOperation boolean operation to remove materials from the preceding CAD models. This will create a rectangular prism with rounded corners. Final Shape The final shape of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular protrusion on top. The shape is symmetrical and appears to be a stylized representation of a building or structure. The dimensions of the final shape are: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.25 - Height: 0.75</description>
